org.openimaj.io

Class IOUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.io.IOUtils

  • public class IOUtils
extends Object
    Methods for reading Readable objects and writing Writeable objects.
    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk), Sina Samangooei (ss@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

      • read

        public static <T extends org.openimaj.io.InternalReadable> T read(InputStream fis,
                                                  T obj)
                                                       throws IOException
        Read an instance of an object from an input stream. The stream is tested to contain the ASCII or binary header and the appropriate read instance is called.
        Type Parameters:
        T - instance type expected
        Parameters:
        fis - the input stream
        obj - the object to instantiate
        Returns:
        the object
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem reading the stream from the file
        See Also:
        ReadableBinary.binaryHeader(), ReadableBinary.readBinary(java.io.DataInput), ReadableASCII.readASCII(java.util.Scanner)

      • isBinary

        public static boolean isBinary(BufferedInputStream bis,
               byte[] header)
                        throws IOException
        Checks whether a given input stream contains readable binary information by checking for the first header.length bytes == header. The stream is reset to the beginning of the header once checked.
        Parameters:
        bis - stream containing data
        header - expected binary header
        Returns:
        does the stream contain binary information
        Throws:
        IOException - problem reading or reseting the stream

      • writeBinary

        public static <T extends WriteableBinary> void writeBinary(BufferedOutputStream bos,
                                           T obj)
                        throws IOException
        Writeable object is written to the output stream in binary format. Firstly the binaryHeader is written then the object is handed the output stream to write it's content.
        Type Parameters:
        T - instance type expected
        Parameters:
        bos - the output stream
        obj - the object to write
        Throws:
        IOException - error writing to stream
        See Also:
        WriteableBinary.writeBinary(java.io.DataOutput), WriteableBinary.binaryHeader()

      • readable

        public static <T extends org.openimaj.io.InternalReadable> boolean readable(File f,
                                                            Class<T> cls)
                        throws IOException
        Check whether a given file is readable by a given Writeable class. Instantiates the class to get it's binary and ascii header which is then passed to the byte[] version of this method
        Type Parameters:
        T - instance type expected
        Parameters:
        f - the file to check
        cls - the class to instantiate the Readable object
        Returns:
        is file readable by a given class
        Throws:
        IOException - error reading file
        See Also:
        ReadableASCII.asciiHeader()

      • readable

        public static boolean readable(File f,
               String header)
                        throws IOException
        Check whether a file is readable by checking it's first bytes contains the header. Converts the header to a byte[] and calls the byte[] version of this method
        Parameters:
        f - the file to check
        header - the header to check with
        Returns:
        does this file contain this header
        Throws:
        IOException - error reading file
        See Also:
        readable(File, byte[])

      • readable

        public static boolean readable(File f,
               byte[] header)
                        throws IOException
        Check readability by checking whether a file starts with a given header. Instantiate an input stream and check whether the stream isBinary (i.e. starts with the header)
        Parameters:
        f - file to check
        header - the expected header
        Returns:
        does the file start with the header
        Throws:
        IOException - error reading file
        See Also:
        isBinary(BufferedInputStream, byte[])

      • readable

        public static <T extends org.openimaj.io.InternalReadable> boolean readable(BufferedInputStream bis,
                                                            Class<T> cls)
                        throws IOException
        Check whether an InputStream can be read by an instantiated class based on it's binary and ascii headers. Buffered so the stream can be reset after the check.
        Type Parameters:
        T - instance type expected
        Parameters:
        bis - the stream
        cls - the class to instantiate and check
        Returns:
        can an object be read from this stream of the class type
        Throws:
        IOException - error reading stream

      • readable

        public static boolean readable(BufferedInputStream bis,
               String header)
                        throws IOException
        Check whether an input stream starts with a header string. Calls the byte[] version of this function
        Parameters:
        bis - the input stream
        header - the header
        Returns:
        whether the stream starts with the string
        Throws:
        IOException - error reading stream
        See Also:
        isBinary(BufferedInputStream, byte[])

      • readable

        public static boolean readable(BufferedInputStream bis,
               byte[] header)
                        throws IOException
        Check whether a stream starts with a header. Uses isBinary (therefore resetting the stream after the check)
        Parameters:
        bis - the input stream
        header - the byte[] header
        Returns:
        whether the stream starts with the header
        Throws:
        IOException - error reading stream

      • serialize

        public static byte[] serialize(WriteableBinary object)
                        throws IOException
        Convenience function for serializing a writeable object as a byte array. Calls writeBinary(OutputStream, WriteableBinary) on a ByteArrayOutputStream then calls ByteArrayOutputStream.toByteArray()
        Parameters:
        object -
        Returns:
        serialised object
        Throws:
        IOException

      • fromString

        public static <T extends ReadableASCII> T fromString(String source,
                                     Class<T> clazz)
                                          throws IOException
        Convenience function for deserializing an object from a String. Calls ReadableASCII.readASCII(Scanner) with a Scanner initialized from a StringReader
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type to output
        Parameters:
        source - where to read from
        clazz - the class of the output
        Returns:
        a new instance of T
        Throws:
        IOException

      • deserialize

        public static <T extends org.openimaj.io.InternalReadable> T deserialize(byte[] source,
                                                         T instance)
                                                              throws IOException
        Convenience function for deserializing an object from a byte array. Calls read(InputStream, Class) on a ByteArrayInputStream.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type to output
        Parameters:
        source - where to read from
        instance - a T instance
        Returns:
        a new instance of T
        Throws:
        IOException

      • writeToFile

        public static void writeToFile(Object obj,
               File out)
                        throws IOException
        Writes an object to a file using the Kryo serialisation library. The object doesn't need to have any special serialisation attributes.
        Parameters:
        obj - the object to write
        out - the output sink
        Throws:
        IOException

      • write

         DataOutput out)
                  throws IOException
        Writes an object using the Kryo serialisation library. The object doesn't need to have any special serialisation attributes.
        Parameters:
        obj - the object to write
        out - the output sink
        Throws:
        IOException

      • read

              throws IOException
        Utility method to read any object written with write(Object, DataOutput).
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of object
        Parameters:
        in - input
        Returns:
        the object
        Throws:
        IOException

                      throws IOException

        Parameters:

        the object
        Throws:

      • canRead

        public static boolean canRead(InputStreamObjectReader<?> reader,
              BufferedInputStream is,
              String name)
                       throws IOException
        Test whether the data in the given InputStream can be read by the given InputStreamObjectReader. This method tries to ensure that the stream is reset to its initial condition.
        Parameters:
        reader - the InputStreamObjectReader.
        is - the stream
        name - the name of the file/object behind the stream (can be null)
        Returns:
        true if the InputStreamObjectReader can read from this stream; false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs resetting the stream.

      • canRead

        public static <SRC> boolean canRead(ObjectReader<?,SRC> reader,
                    SRC source,
                    String name)
                       throws IOException
        Test whether the data in the given source can be read by the given ObjectReader.
        Parameters:
        reader - the ObjectReader.
        source - the source
        name - the name of the file/object behind the stream (can be null)
        Returns:
        true if the ObjectReader can read from this stream; false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs resetting the stream.
